【1】 Brand Names: US
【2】 Brand Names: Canada
【3】 What is this drug used for?
【4】 It is used to treat high blood pressure.
【5】 It is used to treat some types of chest pain (angina).
【6】 It is used in some people to lower the chance of having to go to the hospital for chest pain (angina) and needing certain heart procedures.
【7】 It may be given to you for other reasons. Talk with the doctor.
【8】 What do I need to tell my doctor BEFORE I take this drug?
【9】 If you are allergic to this drug; any part of this drug; or any other drugs, foods, or substances. Tell your doctor about the allergy and what signs you had.
【10】 This drug may interact with other drugs or health problems.
【11】 Tell your doctor and pharmacist about all of your drugs (prescription or OTC, natural products, vitamins) and health problems. You must check to make sure that it is safe for you to take this drug with all of your drugs and health problems. Do not start, stop, or change the dose of any drug without checking with your doctor.
【12】 What are some things I need to know or do while I take this drug?
【13】 **For all uses of this drug:**
【14】 Tell all of your health care providers that you take this drug. This includes your doctors, nurses, pharmacists, and dentists.
【15】 Avoid driving and doing other tasks or actions that call for you to be alert until you see how this drug affects you.
【16】 To lower the chance of feeling dizzy or passing out, rise slowly if you have been sitting or lying down. Be careful going up and down stairs.
【17】 Check your blood pressure as you have been told.
【18】 It is rare, but chest pain that is new or worse can happen after this drug is first started or after the dose is raised. Heart attack can also happen. The risk may be greater in people who have very bad heart blood vessel disease. Talk with the doctor.
【19】 If you are taking this drug and have high blood pressure, talk with your doctor before using OTC products that may raise blood pressure. These include cough or cold drugs, diet pills, stimulants, non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) like ibuprofen or naproxen, and some natural products or aids.
【20】 Talk with your doctor before you drink alcohol.
【21】 Liver problems have happened with this drug. Sometimes, liver problems have needed to be treated in the hospital. Talk with the doctor.
【22】 If you are 65 or older, use this drug with care. You could have more side effects.
【23】 Tell your doctor if you are pregnant, plan on getting pregnant, or are breast-feeding. You will need to talk about the benefits and risks to you and the baby.
【24】 **For chest pain:**
【25】 Do not use this drug to treat sudden chest pain. It will not help. Talk with your doctor.
【26】 What are some side effects that I need to call my doctor about right away?
【27】 **WARNING/CAUTION:** Even though it may be rare, some people may have very bad and sometimes deadly side effects when taking a drug. Tell your doctor or get medical help right away if you have any of the following signs or symptoms that may be related to a very bad side effect:
【28】 Signs of an allergic reaction, like rash; hives; itching; red, swollen, blistered, or peeling skin with or without fever; wheezing; tightness in the chest or throat; trouble breathing, swallowing, or talking; unusual hoarseness; or swelling of the mouth, face, lips, tongue, or throat.
【29】 Signs of liver problems like dark urine, tiredness, decreased appetite, upset stomach or stomach pain, light-colored stools, throwing up, or yellow skin or eyes.
【30】 Very bad dizziness or passing out.
【31】 Chest pain that is new or worse.
【32】 Fast or abnormal heartbeat.
【33】 Swelling.
【34】 Stiff muscles, shakiness, or muscle movements that are not normal.
【35】 What are some other side effects of this drug?
【36】 All drugs may cause side effects. However, many people have no side effects or only have minor side effects. Call your doctor or get medical help if any of these side effects or any other side effects bother you or do not go away:
【37】 Feeling dizzy, sleepy, tired, or weak.
【38】 Flushing.
【39】 Upset stomach.
【40】 Stomach pain.
【41】 These are not all of the side effects that may occur. If you have questions about side effects, call your doctor. Call your doctor for medical advice about side effects.
【42】 You may report side effects to your national health agency.
【43】 How is this drug best taken?
【44】 Use this drug as ordered by your doctor. Read all information given to you. Follow all instructions closely.
【45】 **All products:**
【46】 Take this drug at the same time of day.
【47】 Take with or without food.
【48】 Keep taking this drug as you have been told by your doctor or other health care provider, even if you feel well.
【49】 **All liquid products:**
【50】 Measure liquid doses carefully. Use the measuring device that comes with this drug. If there is none, ask the pharmacist for a device to measure this drug.
【51】 **Liquid (suspension):**
【52】 Shake well before use.
【53】 What do I do if I miss a dose?
【54】 Take a missed dose as soon as you think about it.
【55】 If it has been 12 hours or more since the missed dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your normal time.
【56】 Do not take 2 doses at the same time or extra doses.
【57】 How do I store and/or throw out this drug?
【58】 **Tablets:**
【59】 Store at room temperature protected from light. Store in a dry place. Do not store in a bathroom.
【60】 **Liquid (solution):**
【61】 Store in the original container at room temperature.
【62】 Store in a dry place. Do not store in a bathroom.
【63】 **Liquid (suspension):**
【64】 Store in a refrigerator. Do not freeze.
【65】 Protect from heat and light.
【66】 **All products:**
【67】 Keep all drugs in a safe place. Keep all drugs out of the reach of children and pets.
【68】 Throw away unused or expired drugs. Do not flush down a toilet or pour down a drain unless you are told to do so. Check with your pharmacist if you have questions about the best way to throw out drugs. There may be drug take-back programs in your area.
【69】 General drug facts
【70】 If your symptoms or health problems do not get better or if they become worse, call your doctor.
【71】 Do not share your drugs with others and do not take anyone else's drugs.
【72】 Some drugs may have another patient information leaflet. If you have any questions about this drug, please talk with your doctor, nurse, pharmacist, or other health care provider.
【73】 If you think there has been an overdose, call your poison control center or get medical care right away. Be ready to tell or show what was taken, how much, and when it happened.
source_info.title: Amlodipine  Patient drug information

source_info.text:
【0】 Belatacept  Patient drug information
【1】 Brand Names: US
【2】 Warning
【3】 The chance of posttransplant lymphoproliferative disorder (PTLD) may be raised with this drug. PTLD happens when your white blood cells grow out of control. This can lead to a type of cancer and can be deadly.
【4】 This drug may raise the chance of very bad and sometimes deadly infections. Tell your doctor if you get signs of infection like a fever of 100.4°F (38°C) or higher, chills, very bad sore throat, ear or sinus pain, cough, more sputum or change in color of sputum, pain with passing urine, mouth sores, wound that will not heal, or anal itching or pain.
【5】 Drugs that may suppress the immune system like this drug may raise the risk of cancer. If you have questions, talk with the doctor.
【6】 Do not use this drug if you have not been exposed to Epstein Bar Virus (EBV) or if you are not sure. Do not use this drug if you have had a liver transplant.
【7】 What is this drug used for?
【8】 It is used after a kidney transplant to keep the body from rejecting the kidney.
【9】 It may be given to you for other reasons. Talk with the doctor.
【10】 What do I need to tell my doctor BEFORE I take this drug?
【11】 If you are allergic to this drug; any part of this drug; or any other drugs, foods, or substances. Tell your doctor about the allergy and what signs you had.
【12】 If you have been taking cyclosporine or tacrolimus and will be switching to this drug.
【13】 This is not a list of all drugs or health problems that interact with this drug.
【14】 Tell your doctor and pharmacist about all of your drugs (prescription or OTC, natural products, vitamins) and health problems. You must check to make sure that it is safe for you to take this drug with all of your drugs and health problems. Do not start, stop, or change the dose of any drug without checking with your doctor.
【15】 What are some things I need to know or do while I take this drug?
【16】 Tell all of your health care providers that you take this drug. This includes your doctors, nurses, pharmacists, and dentists.
【17】 Have your blood work and other lab tests checked as you have been told by your doctor.
【18】 High blood sugar has happened with this drug. This includes diabetes that is new or worse.
【19】 Check your blood sugar as you have been told by your doctor.
【20】 Tell your doctor if you have signs of high blood sugar like confusion, feeling sleepy, unusual thirst or hunger, passing urine more often, flushing, fast breathing, or breath that smells like fruit.
【21】 The chance of skin cancer may be raised. Avoid lots of sun, sunlamps, and tanning beds. Use sunscreen and wear clothing and eyewear that protects you from the sun.
【22】 You may have more chance of getting an infection. Wash hands often. Stay away from people with infections, colds, or flu.
【23】 You will need a TB (tuberculosis) test before starting this drug.
【24】 Talk with your doctor before getting any vaccines. Use of some vaccines with this drug may either raise the chance of an infection or make the vaccine not work as well.
【25】 A severe brain problem called progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy (PML) has happened with this drug. It may cause disability or can be deadly. Tell your doctor right away if you have signs like confusion, memory problems, depression, change in the way you act, change in strength on 1 side is greater than the other, trouble speaking or thinking, change in balance, or change in eyesight.
【26】 Tell your doctor if you are pregnant, plan on getting pregnant, or are breast-feeding. You will need to talk about the benefits and risks to you and the baby.
【27】 What are some side effects that I need to call my doctor about right away?
【28】 **WARNING/CAUTION:** Even though it may be rare, some people may have very bad and sometimes deadly side effects when taking a drug. Tell your doctor or get medical help right away if you have any of the following signs or symptoms that may be related to a very bad side effect:
【29】 Signs of an allergic reaction, like rash; hives; itching; red, swollen, blistered, or peeling skin with or without fever; wheezing; tightness in the chest or throat; trouble breathing, swallowing, or talking; unusual hoarseness; or swelling of the mouth, face, lips, tongue, or throat.
【30】 Signs of a urinary tract infection (UTI) like blood in the urine, burning or pain when passing urine, feeling the need to pass urine often or right away, fever, lower stomach pain, or pelvic pain.
【31】 Signs of electrolyte problems like mood changes; confusion; muscle pain, cramps, or spasms; weakness; shakiness; change in balance; an abnormal heartbeat; seizures; loss of appetite; or severe upset stomach or throwing up.
【32】 Signs of high or low blood pressure like very bad headache or dizziness, passing out, or change in eyesight.
【33】 Flu-like signs.
【34】 Signs of a common cold.
【35】 Feeling very tired or weak.
【36】 Swelling in the arms or legs.
【37】 Fever that does not go away.
【38】 Change in color or size of a mole.
【39】 A skin lump or growth.
【40】 Mental, mood, or behavior changes that are new or worse.
【41】 Tenderness in the area over the kidney transplant.
【42】 Call your doctor right away if you have a swollen gland, night sweats, shortness of breath, or weight loss without trying.
【43】 Some people treated with this drug have had very bad kidney problems caused by a certain viral infection (BK virus). In people who have had a kidney transplant, BK virus infection may cause loss of the kidney. Call your doctor right away if you have signs of kidney problems like change in the amount of urine passed, difficulty or pain when passing urine, or blood in the urine.
【44】 What are some other side effects of this drug?
【45】 All drugs may cause side effects. However, many people have no side effects or only have minor side effects. Call your doctor or get medical help if any of these side effects or any other side effects bother you or do not go away:
【46】 Dizziness or headache.
【47】 Constipation, diarrhea, stomach pain, upset stomach, or throwing up.
【48】 Joint pain.
【49】 Back pain.
【50】 Trouble sleeping.
【51】 Anxiety.
【52】 Shakiness.
【53】 These are not all of the side effects that may occur. If you have questions about side effects, call your doctor. Call your doctor for medical advice about side effects.
【54】 You may report side effects to your national health agency.
【55】 How is this drug best taken?
【56】 Use this drug as ordered by your doctor. Read all information given to you. Follow all instructions closely.
【57】 It is given as an infusion into a vein over a period of time.
【58】 What do I do if I miss a dose?
【59】 Call your doctor to find out what to do.
【60】 How do I store and/or throw out this drug?
【61】 If you need to store this drug at home, talk with your doctor, nurse, or pharmacist about how to store it.
【62】 General drug facts
【63】 If your symptoms or health problems do not get better or if they become worse, call your doctor.
【64】 Do not share your drugs with others and do not take anyone else's drugs.
【65】 Keep all drugs in a safe place. Keep all drugs out of the reach of children and pets.
【66】 Throw away unused or expired drugs. Do not flush down a toilet or pour down a drain unless you are told to do so. Check with your pharmacist if you have questions about the best way to throw out drugs. There may be drug take-back programs in your area.
【67】 Some drugs may have another patient information leaflet. If you have any questions about this drug, please talk with your doctor, nurse, pharmacist, or other health care provider.
【68】 If you think there has been an overdose, call your poison control center or get medical care right away. Be ready to tell or show what was taken, how much, and when it happened.
source_info.title: Belatacept  Patient drug information

source_info.text:
【0】 Burosumab  Pediatric drug information
【1】 For abbreviations, symbols, and age group definitions used in Lexicomp
【2】 Brand Names: US
【3】 Brand Names: Canada
【4】 Therapeutic Category
【5】 Dosing: Pediatric
【6】 Osteomalacia, tumor-induced
【7】 Dosing: Kidney Impairment: Pediatric
【8】 Infants ≥6 months, Children, and Adolescents:
【9】 Mild to moderate impairment: There are no dosing adjustments provided in the manufacturer's labeling (has not been studied); use with caution. Increased serum phosphorus may occur with renal impairment; in addition, burosumab may also cause hyperphosphatemia with risk of nephrocalcinosis; serum phosphorus levels should be monitored very closely.
【10】 Severe renal impairment or end-stage renal disease: Use is contraindicated.
【11】 Dosing: Hepatic Impairment: Pediatric
【12】 There are no dosing adjustments provided in the manufacturer's labeling (has not been studied); use with caution.
【13】 Dosing: Adult
【14】 Dosing: Kidney Impairment: Adult
【15】 CrCl ≥30 mL/minute: There are no dosage adjustments provided in the manufacturer's labeling.
【16】 CrCl <30 mL/minute: Use is contraindicated.
【17】 Dosing: Hepatic Impairment: Adult
【18】 There are no dosage adjustments provided in the manufacturer's labeling.
【19】 Adverse Reactions
【20】 The following adverse drug reactions and incidences are derived from product labeling unless otherwise specified.
【21】 >10%:
【22】 Dermatologic: Eczema (adults: 11%), skin rash (10% to 27%)
【23】 Endocrine & metabolic: Vitamin D deficiency (children: 24% to 37%; adults: 7% to 12%)
【24】 Gastrointestinal: Constipation (9% to 17%), dental caries (children: 31%), diarrhea (children: 24%), toothache (children: 23%), tooth infection (adults: 13%), vomiting (children: 41% to 48%)
【25】 Immunologic: Antibody development (14% to 19%)
【26】 Infection: Tooth abscess (15% to 34%)
【27】 Local: Injection site reaction (children: 52% to 67%; adults: 15%)
【28】 Nervous system: Dizziness (10% to 15%), headache (children: 34% to 73%; adults: 11% to 13%), restless leg syndrome (adults: 7% to 12%)
【29】 Neuromuscular & skeletal: Back pain (adults: 15%), limb pain (children: 38% to 46%), muscle spasm (adults: 7% to 19%), myalgia (children: 17%)
【30】 Respiratory: Cough (children: 52%)
【31】 Miscellaneous: Fever (children: 44% to 55%)
【32】 1% to 10%:
【33】 Dermatologic: Rash at injection site (children: 10%), urticaria at injection site (children: 7%)
【34】 Endocrine & metabolic: Hyperphosphatemia (adults: ≤7%)
【35】 Gastrointestinal: Nausea (children: 10%)
【36】 Hypersensitivity: Hypersensitivity reaction (adults: 6% to 22%)
【37】 Contraindications
【38】 Concomitant use with oral phosphate and/or active vitamin D analogs (eg, calcitriol, paricalcitol, doxercalciferol, calcifediol); serum phosphorus within or above normal range for age; severe renal impairment or end-stage renal disease.
【39】 Significant drug interactions exist, requiring dose/frequency adjustment or avoidance. Consult drug interactions database for more information.
【40】 Warnings/Precautions
【41】 Hyperphosphatemia: Elevated serum phosphorus may increase the risk of nephrocalcinosis; dose reduction or interruption of therapy may be required. To prevent hyperphosphatemia, interrupt burosumab therapy in patients with tumor-induced osteomalacia receiving treatment for the underlying tumor. Reassess serum phosphorus after underlying tumor-related treatment has been completed; reinitiate and adjust burosumab dose as clinically necessary.
【42】 Hypersensitivity: May cause hypersensitivity reactions (eg, rash, urticaria). Discontinue therapy immediately if serious hypersensitivity reactions occur.
【43】 Injection site reactions: Local injection site reactions may occur. Most reactions are mild in severity, occur within 1 day of injection, and typically resolve within 1 to 3 days with no treatment. Discontinue use if severe injection site reactions occur.
【44】 Restless leg syndrome: New onset or worsening of existing restless leg syndrome has been reported in adults.
【45】 Polysorbate 80: Some dosage forms may contain polysorbate 80 (also known as Tweens). Hypersensitivity reactions, usually a delayed reaction, have been reported following exposure to pharmaceutical products containing polysorbate 80 in certain individuals (Isaksson 2002; Lucente 2000; Shelley 1995). Thrombocytopenia, ascites, pulmonary deterioration, and renal and hepatic failure have been reported in premature neonates after receiving parenteral products containing polysorbate 80 (Alade 1986; CDC 1984). See manufacturer's labeling.
【46】 Vitamin D: May decrease serum vitamin D. Monitor serum 25(OH)D levels; supplement with cholecalciferol or ergocalciferol to maintain age-based normal range. Do NOT administer active vitamin D analogs during burosumab treatment.
【47】 Dosage Forms: US
【48】 Excipient information presented when available (limited, particularly for generics); consult specific product labeling.
【49】 Solution, Subcutaneous [preservative free]:
【50】 Crysvita: Burosumab-twza 10 mg/mL (1 mL); Burosumab-twza 20 mg/mL (1 mL); Burosumab-twza 30 mg/mL (1 mL) [contains polysorbate 80]
【51】 Generic Equivalent Available: US
【52】 No
【53】 Pricing: US
【54】 10 mg/mL (per mL): $5,087.38
【55】 20 mg/mL (per mL): $10,174.75
【56】 30 mg/mL (per mL): $15,262.13
【57】 Dosage Forms: Canada
【58】 Solution, Subcutaneous:
【59】 Administration: Pediatric
【60】 Parenteral: SubQ: Administer undiluted SubQ in upper arms, upper thighs, buttocks, or any quadrant of the abdomen; rotate injection sites with each injection. Avoid injection sites where skin is tender, bruised, red, hard, not intact, or areas with moles or scars. The maximum SubQ volume per injection site is 1.5 mL; larger dose volumes need to be split between 2 injection sites. Inspect vial prior to use; do not use if solution is discolored, cloudy, or contains particulate matter.
【61】 Administration: Adult
【62】 Storage/Stability
【63】 Store at 2°C to 8°C (36°F to 46°F) in the original carton; do not freeze. Protect from light. Do not shake.
【64】 Use
【65】 Treatment of X-linked hypophosphatemia (XLH) (FDA approved in ages ≥6 months and adults); treatment of fibroblast growth factor 23 (FGF23)-related hypophosphatemia in tumor-induced osteomalacia associated with phosphaturic mesenchymal tumors that cannot be curatively resected or localized (FDA approved in ages ≥2 years and adults).
【66】 Medication Safety Issues
【67】 High alert medication:
【68】 Metabolism/Transport Effects
【69】 None known.
【70】 Drug Interactions
【71】 Efgartigimod Alfa: May diminish the therapeutic effect of Fc Receptor-Binding Agents. Risk C: Monitor therapy
【72】 Phosphate Supplements: May enhance the adverse/toxic effect of Burosumab. Risk X: Avoid combination
【73】 Rozanolixizumab: May diminish the therapeutic effect of Fc Receptor-Binding Agents. Risk C: Monitor therapy
【74】 Vitamin D Analogs: May enhance the adverse/toxic effect of Burosumab. Risk X: Avoid combination
【75】 Pregnancy Considerations
【76】 Burosumab is a human IgG monoclonal antibody and may be transferred across the placenta. Maternal serum phosphorus concentrations should be monitored.
【77】 Health care providers are encouraged to report exposures of burosumab during pregnancy to the manufacturer Adverse Event reporting line (888-756-8657).
【78】 Monitoring Parameters
【79】 Hypersensitivity reactions, local injection-site reactions, serum 25-hydroxy vitamin D levels.
【80】 Fasting serum phosphorus: 3.1 to 6.2 mg/dL (ASPEN [Corkins 2015]); normal ranges are higher in younger patients. In clinical trials of children 5 to 12 years, a target range of 3.5 to 4.5 mg/dL was used (Carpenter 2018).
【81】 Age-directed normal ranges (Kliegman 2020):
【82】 1 to 3 years: 3.8 to 6.5 mg/dL.
【83】 4 to 11 years: 3.7 to 5.6 mg/dL.
【84】 12 to 15 years: 2.9 to 5.4 mg/dL.
【85】 16 to 19 years: 2.7 to 4.7 mg/dL.
【86】 Mechanism of Action
【87】 Burosumab binds to and inhibits the activity of fibroblast growth factor 23, thereby restoring renal phosphate reabsorption and increasing the serum concentration of 1,25 dihydroxy vitamin D.
【88】 Pharmacokinetics (Adult Data Unless Noted)
【89】 Distribution: Vd: 8 L
【90】 Metabolism: Degraded into small peptides and amino acids via catabolic pathways
【91】 Half-life elimination: ~19 days
【92】 Time to peak: 8 to 11 days
【93】 Pharmacokinetics: Additional Considerations (Adult Data Unless Noted)
【94】 Body weight: Clearance and volume of distribution of burosumab increases with body weight.
【95】 Brand Names: International
【96】 International Brand Names by Country
source_info.title: Burosumab  Pediatric drug information
